ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'

about.summary: Provides tools useful for measurement theory (Allen & Yen 2001)<ISBN: 157766230X>, meta-analysis (validity-generalization) (Schmidt & Hunter)<doi:10.4135/9781483398105>, reliability, item analysis, inter-rater reliability, classical utility, and correlation analysis  (Cohen et. al. 2003)<doi:10.4324/9780203774441>.

Provides tools useful for measurement theory (Allen & Yen 2001)<ISBN: 157766230X>, meta-analysis (validity-generalization) (Schmidt & Hunter)<doi:10.4135/9781483398105>, reliability, item analysis, inter-rater reliability, classical utility, and correlation analysis  (Cohen et. al. 2003)<doi:10.4324/9780203774441>.

name: r-psychometric
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.4" %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-psychometric
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/psychometric_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/psychometric/psychometric_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 3af43437f3624069532862c697276b881a7158243aa83dbd9b675d80f87f8fd6

build:
  number: 2
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip  # [win]

  host:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr
    - r-multilevel
    - r-nlme
    - r-purrr

  run:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr
    - r-multilevel
    - r-nlme
    - r-purrr

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('psychometric')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('psychometric')\""  # [win]
about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=psychometric
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: 'Provides tools useful for measurement theory (Allen & Yen 2001)<ISBN: 157766230X>, meta-analysis (validity-generalization) (Schmidt & Hunter)<doi:10.4135/9781483398105>, reliability, item analysis, inter-rater reliability, classical utility, and correlation analysis  (Cohen et. al. 2003)<doi:10.4324/9780203774441>.'
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - thewchan

# The original CRAN metadata for this package was:

# Package: psychometric
# Type: Package
# Title: Applied Psychometric Theory
# Version: 2.3
# Date: 2022-05-27
# Depends: dplyr, multilevel, purrr, nlme
# Author: Thomas D. Fletcher
# Maintainer: Thomas D. Fletcher <t.d.fletcher05@gmail.com>
# Description: Provides tools useful for measurement theory (Allen & Yen 2001)<ISBN: 157766230X>, meta-analysis (validity-generalization) (Schmidt & Hunter)<doi:10.4135/9781483398105>, reliability, item analysis, inter-rater reliability, classical utility, and correlation analysis  (Cohen et. al. 2003)<doi:10.4324/9780203774441>.
# License: GPL (>= 2)
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2022-06-02 14:37:59 UTC; jdaniel
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2022-06-03 08:00:02 UTC

# See
# https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda-build for
